medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic intraocular inflammation in the right eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms included progressively decreasing vision and floaters in the right eye that lasted for 18 months. The patient had been unsuccessfully treated with topical and subtenon steroids. At presentation, best-corrected visual acuity was 20/400 in the right eye.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Significant for 2 cardiac angioplasties and a thyroidectomy for a benign tumor, and previous treatment for pulmonary Valley fever with oral fluconazole 8 years before.
medical_history.social_history: Patient reported having been hunting in the high desert.
